info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 4:25PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pitkin County through 500 PM MDT... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Carbondale, or 11 miles southeast of Glenwood Springs, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and pea size hail. Very heavy rainfall and possible excess runoff. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Pitkin County, including the following locations... Cattle Creek. This includes the following highways... Colorado 82 between mile markers 9 and 16. Colorado 133 between mile markers 63 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
